Soma：1．Soma． See Sutasoma．

2．Soma

A deva to whom sacrifice is offered； he is generally mentioned with Varuna，Pajāpati and Yama （D．i．244；ii．259； J．v．28； vi．201，568，571）．

In the Atānātiya Sutta （D．iii．204） he is spoken of as a Yakkha chief．

He is identified with the Moon god of later literature （E．g．，Cv．lxii．5； lxiii．14），the founder of the Somavamsa （dynasty）．

3．Soma． A Yavapāla who offered grass for his seat to Kassapa Buddha．BuA．218； cf．Mtu．iii．105，106．

4．Soma．-Friend of Somadatta （5）．
